projects.title: 洄鄉 | Echo-me
projects.description: An interactive installation exploring species fusion and migration, interweaving human and fish silhouettes to create a symbiotic network of life.

hero.subtitle: Exploring species fusion and the journey of migration and return

about.leadText: Echo-me interweaves the silhouettes of humans and fish, creating a fusion of species that symbolizes the invisible force flowing through all life, forming a network of co-existence.
paragraphs: The work depicts 'homeward migration' as species slowly traverse urban landscapes and shimmering waters, with visuals extending in a rippling effect that symbolizes the force of returning to origins.
When viewers stand before the work, they become part of this discussion—the installation detects their presence and generates new on-screen characters that join the procession of species.
This symbolizes the integration and continuity of human history with nature, exploring the idea that migration and return reflect humanity's search for and return to its origins.

projects.title: 痕跡 | Traces
projects.description: Drawing inspiration from ceramic crazing to investigate the aesthetic interplay between temporality and human intervention through quadtree structures.

hero.subtitle: Exploring temporal dynamics through ceramic crazing patterns

about.leadText: Traces reinterprets the temporality and aesthetic qualities of ceramic crack patterns through digitalization, focusing on traces left by the passage of time and human intervention.
paragraphs: This work views cracks as a tangible representation of time, simulating the accumulation of natural patterns over time while incorporating the uniqueness introduced by human intervention.
The work extends crack expression by creating diverse visual forms, including crystal engraving, ripples, and skin meridians, liberating cracks from traditional ceramic frameworks.
This contemporary interpretation combines digital media and procedural generation, expanding the expressive possibilities of cracks as symbols of time and culture.

The game uses image recognition to detect body movements, combined with gamification to create an engaging fitness experience inspired by Taiwan's iconic garbage truck culture.
Designed for all ages with accessible movements, the game requires no additional equipment—just a smartphone camera and space to move.

projects.title: 存在觀察 | Existence Observation
projects.description: A multimedia installation exploring consciousness, energy, and existence through mixed reality and point cloud visualization.

hero.subtitle: Exploring invisible existence through mixed reality

about.leadText: A work exploring the invisible particles that constitute reality—data, consciousness, imagination, and wishes—existing and changing in imperceptible ways to construct human experience.
paragraphs: The installation uses a 'window' (door) as a symbolic visual medium, with the exhibition space 'Art Space' as the basis for a point cloud model, recreated using Unreal Engine.
When observers pause and stay, they can glimpse existence that was once imperceptible to the naked eye through the 'window' and resonate with it.
The work consists of four stages of imagery, progressing from door/theater opening, to energy/existence, to consciousness and emotion, creating a journey through invisible dimensions.

Once all suitable planting areas are correctly cultivated, the World Tree gradually grows, symbolizing the player's exploration journey and environmental restoration.

hero.subtitle: Vast spaces, time focused on a single day

about.leadText: Using Zhongzheng Road Night Market as the main scene, scanned into a point cloud model with atmospheric effects for day and night, offering an audiovisual experience traversing time and space.
paragraphs: History lingers in certain corners of Hsinchu. The old town stands on the periphery of the modern city, having witnessed both prosperity and decline.

The work creates distinct atmospheres for daytime and nighttime through fog, lighting variations, color shifts, particle dynamics, and post-processing, combined with field-recorded sounds.

hero.subtitle: An irregular approach to visualizing convergence

about.leadText: Using Vermeer's painting 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' as the foundation, this work explores an irregular approach to visualizing the convergence of longing and remembrance.
paragraphs: The work employs Brownian motion and random walk algorithms to create organic, unpredictable patterns of convergence.
Through GLSL shader programming, the iconic painting is deconstructed and reconstructed through particle movements.
The result is a meditation on memory, longing, and the non-linear nature of emotional connections.

projects.title: 墨染熹微 | Smudge of Dawn
projects.description: A GLSL artwork inspired by Karesansui (Japanese rock gardens), depicting dawn light diffusing over mountains through ink painting aesthetics.

hero.subtitle: Expressing water without water—ink painting in code

about.leadText: Created using GLSL, incorporating traditional Chinese ink painting aesthetics to depict soft morning light gently diffusing over mountains in a Karesansui-inspired composition.
paragraphs: Karesansui uses rocks and white sand to emulate mountains and rivers, achieving 'expressing water without water.'
The 'ground' represented by white sand and water patterns is generated through trigonometric functions, forming wave-like shapes that extend and flow.
Disturbances are added to ripple surfaces for a granular, sand-like texture, with three white stones placed as mountain elements.

projects.title: Time Lapse
projects.description: A sound art piece exploring the pandemic through media transcription, modulation, and audio-visual experimentation with TouchDesigner.

about.leadText: Exploring the pandemic's two-year journey from anxiety to acceptance, standing in solidarity with frontline workers to combat the crisis together.
paragraphs: Incorporating news reports and various foley sounds from Freesound, using Ableton's effects for modulation techniques such as echo, layering, and repetition.
TouchDesigner generates audiovisual elements, providing viewers with a dynamic visual perception that complements the sound.
Five sections explore themes of lurking viruses, separation and fusion, struggle, public discourse, and coexistence despite societal cracks.

projects.description: A VR escape room experience with hand tracking, set in a Victorian-era ship where players unravel mysteries and free trapped souls.

hero.subtitle: VR escape room with hand tracking interaction

about.leadText: On an unexpected archaeological journey, you step into an astonishing world aboard a ship where time has ceased, with everything from the Victorian era frozen in place.
paragraphs: The air is filled with magic, and legends that exist only in myths come to life. Can you unravel mysteries, piece together events, and free souls trapped under ancient spells before time runs out?
After diving into the depths of the sea, you hear a hauntingly beautiful song before gradually losing consciousness. Upon waking, you find yourself inside an unfamiliar ship cabin.
Solving four intricate puzzles triggers the appearance of the captain. The story branches into two paths based on your choices: defeat the mermaid with magic, or use hidden incantations to escape.

projects.title: COVID RUSH
projects.description: An immersive game experience combining Tag elements with environmental puzzle-solving, set during the COVID-19 pandemic.

hero.subtitle: Survive the pandemic in this immersive Tag-style game

about.leadText: An immersive experience combining exploration, puzzle-solving, and survival mechanics set against the backdrop of the COVID-19 pandemic.
paragraphs: Players navigate between safe (green) and dangerous (red) zones that change with the background music. In safe zones, collect masks and vaccines; in danger zones, escape quickly or face elimination.
The story fits current reality with plots, music, and game modes designed to give players nervous feelings and excitement, creating similar but more thrilling experiences than reality.
NPCs may interfere and take items away. Players can knock them out to gain experience, adding strategic depth to survival gameplay.
